Sys::Appfs Class Reference
Inheritance diagram for Sys::Appfs:

Documentation

This class provides an interface for installing programs in the Flash/RAM as well as for saving data to the flash.

The following is a basic example of creating a data file in flash and then reading from it.

#include <stfy/Sys.hpp>
char my_user_data[16];
//populate my_user_data as you please here
Appfs::create("my_data", my_user_data, 16); //creates /app/flash/my_data as read only data

Now reading from the file.

#include <stfy/Sys.hpp>
char my_user_data[16];
File f;
f.open("/app/flash/my_data", File::RDONLY); //only the file read only
f.seek( Appfs::offset() ); //seek to the start of user data
f.read(my_user_data, 16); //read 16 bytes of user data
f.close(); //free resources

Member Function Documentation

static int Sys::Appfs::create ( const char *  name,
const void *  buf,
int  nbyte,
const char *  mount = "/app",
link_transport_phy_t  h = LINK_PHY_OPEN_ERROR 
)
static

Create a data file in the flash memory.

This method creates a file in flash memory consisting of the data specified

Parameters
nameThe name of the data file (no path info)
bufA pointer to the data to be saved
nbyteThe number of bytes to save
mountThe mount path (default is /app)
Returns
Zero on success or -1 with errno set accordingly
static int Sys::Appfs::offset ( void  )
inlinestatic

Returns the offset of user data in the file.

Appfs file contain a header that is only applicable to executable files. This gives the offset of where the user data starts with files created using Appfs::create()

Returns
The offset in bytes
